How can I do it?

Show Dialog box / Popups programmatically in SharePoint 2013

How can I display a dialog box / popup in SharePoint 2013 programatically?

November 22, 2014

Reading time ~14 minutes

Popup / Dialog box is a very important component in SharePoint UI. It can be used to display messages, get information, or open external websites.

In this post we will see how to create a Popup box or Dialog box in SharePoint programmatically.

What are we trying to achieve

Programmatically show Dialog box / Popups in SharePoint 2013 with custom code / C#.
In this post, we will be building two types of dialog boxes.
In the first type, clicking on the “OK” button refreshes the page. This is useful in situations where we are displaying a process complete message or similar.
In the second type, clicking on the “OK” button redirects you to a different page. This can be used in situations where a confirmation needs to be taken etc..

The Result is something like what is shown below.

Tip

If you are familiar with how Model popup & dialog box works in SharePoint, then you can skip to the implementation part.

How it is done in SharePoint Product?

Before we continue, let’s revisit how the OOB dialog boxes are displayed.
When a pop up box needs to be displayed, an application page is loaded using an OOB Model Dialog JavaScript.

For example, consider clicking the New Document button in a Document Library; using Fiddler, we can see that the application page called is
http://howcanidoit.fourthcoffee.dev/_layouts/15/Upload.aspx?List={4B9CFE85-543E-4B64-9D12-CF7ADA634B16}&RootFolder=&IsDlg=1

The upload page is as follows

And opening the url gives us this page

Similarly Check-In calls the page
http://howcanidoit.fourthcoffee.dev/_layouts/15/checkin.aspx?List={4B9CFE85-543E-4B64-9D12-CF7ADA634B16}&FileName=%2FDocuments%2FRandom%20Document%2Edocx&IsDlg=1

Well… You get the idea…

The url contains some parameters relevant to the page we are visiting and an IsDlg=1 property.

The JavaScript APIs to display the dialog box are present in SP.UI.Dialog.Js file and we can use SP.UI.ModalDialog.showModalDialog(options) to display the dialog box.

Note

The corresponding images for Check-in is available in the following links
CheckIn Page
CheckIn Page Url
CheckIn Page url without IsDlg

The IsDlg Property

You would have noticed that opening the url gave a basic page and does not look anything like an application page. This is achieved through the IsDlg=1 parameter passed in the query.
The IsDlg=1 parameter in the query indicate to SharePoint that the application page is intended to be displayed inside a dialog box. This causes SharePoint to display only the content of the page and hide the SharePoint chrome (Header / footer etc).

So opening the Upload Url without the IsDlg=1 parameter gives the following page

That looks like a normal application page.
The Url used was http://howcanidoit.fourthcoffee.dev/_layouts/15/Upload.aspx?List={4B9CFE85-543E-4B64-9D12-CF7ADA634B16}&RootFolder=

Implementation

That’s enough of theory… Let us implement it…

There are four parts to the solution.

  1. Application Page - Displays the message that we need to show.
  2. Wrapper Class - Optionally required to create the correct application page url (with the parameters) and JavaScript function call.
  3. JavaScript functions - Make sure that the SP.UI.Dialog.Js is loaded and calls the required APIs.
  4. Constants Class - Optional. Holds all the constants value.

Application Page

Aspx Page

 1 <asp:Content ID="PageHead" ContentPlaceHolderID="PlaceHolderAdditionalPageHead" runat="server">
 2     <Sharepoint:ScriptLink runat="server" Name="SP.js" Localizable="false"  ID="s1" LoadAfterUI="true"/>
 3     <Sharepoint:ScriptLink runat="server" Name="SP.Runtime.js" Localizable="false"  ID="s2" LoadAfterUI="true"/>
 4 </asp:Content>
 5 
 6 <asp:Content ID="PageTitle" ContentPlaceHolderID="PlaceHolderPageTitle" runat="server">
 7     <%= MessageTitleQueryValue %>
 8 </asp:Content>
 9 
10 <asp:Content ID="PageTitleInTitleArea" ContentPlaceHolderID="PlaceHolderPageTitleInTitleArea" runat="server" >
11     <%= MessageTitleQueryValue %>
12 </asp:Content>
13 
14 <asp:Content ID="Main" ContentPlaceHolderID="PlaceHolderMain" runat="server">
15     <div style="min-height: 150px; padding-bottom: 10px;">
16         <span>
17             <img style="float: left; width: 50px;" src="<%= MessageImageValue %>" alt="<%= MessageImageText %>"/>
18         </span>
19         <p style="margin-left: 60px; min-height: 100px;">
20             <%= MessageContentValue %>
21         </p>
22     </div>
23     <div style="text-align: right;">
24         <% if (MessageButtonOptions.Equals("Ok"))
25            { %>
26             <asp:Button runat="server" ID="OkButton" Text="OK" OnClick="OkButton_OnClick"/>      
27         <% }
28            else if (MessageButtonOptions.Equals("OkCancel"))
29            { %>
30             <asp:Button runat="server" ID="OkButton1" Text="OK" OnClick="OkButton_OnClick"/> &nbsp;&nbsp;
31             <asp:Button runat="server" ID="CancelButton" Text="Cancel" OnClick="CancelButton_OnClick"/>      
32         <% } %>
33         
34     </div>
35 </asp:Content>

Aspx/C# Code Behind

 1 using System;
 2 using System.Linq;
 3 using Microsoft.SharePoint.WebControls;
 4 using SharePointPopups.Common;
 5 
 6 namespace SharePointPopups.Layouts.SharePointPopups
 7 {
 8     /// <summary>
 9     /// Show Message Application Page
10     /// </summary>
11     public partial class ShowMessage : LayoutsPageBase
12     {
13         //Constants      
14         public string MessageButtonOptions = string.Empty;
15         public string MessageContentValue = string.Empty;
16         public string MessageImageText = string.Empty;
17         public string MessageImageValue = string.Empty;
18         public string MessageTitleQueryValue = string.Empty;
19 
20         protected void Page_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)
21         {
22             if (Request.QueryString.AllKeys.Contains(Constants.MessageContentQueryName))
23             {
24                 MessageContentValue = Request.QueryString[Constants.MessageContentQueryName];
25             }
26 
27             if (Request.QueryString.AllKeys.Contains(Constants.MessageTitleQueryName))
28             {
29                 MessageTitleQueryValue = Request.QueryString[Constants.MessageTitleQueryName];
30             }
31 
32             if (Request.QueryString.AllKeys.Contains(Constants.MessageTypeQueryName))
33             {
34                 MessageImageText = Request.QueryString[Constants.MessageTypeQueryName];
35                 switch (Request.QueryString[Constants.MessageTypeQueryName].ToUpperInvariant())
36                 {
37                     case "ERROR":
38                         MessageImageValue = Constants.ErrorImage;
39                         break;
40                     case "WARNING":
41                         MessageImageValue = Constants.WarnImage;
42                         break;
43                     case "INFORMATION":
44                         MessageImageValue = Constants.InfoImage;
45                         break;
46                 }
47             }
48 
49             if (Request.QueryString.AllKeys.Contains(Constants.MessageOptionsQueryName))
50             {
51                 MessageButtonOptions = Request.QueryString[Constants.MessageOptionsQueryName];
52             }
53         }
54 
55         protected void OkButton_OnClick(object sender, EventArgs e)
56         {
57             Page.ClientScript.RegisterStartupScript(GetType(), "PopupScript",
58                 "SP.UI.ModalDialog.commonModalDialogClose(SP.UI.DialogResult.OK, 'OK');", true);
59         }
60 
61         protected void CancelButton_OnClick(object sender, EventArgs e)
62         {
63             Page.ClientScript.RegisterStartupScript(GetType(), "PopupScript",
64                 "SP.UI.ModalDialog.commonModalDialogClose(SP.UI.DialogResult.cancel, 'Cancel');", true);
65         }
66     }
67 }

Wrapper Class

 1 namespace SharePointPopups.Common
 2 {
 3     public static class PopupOperations
 4     {
 5         public static string ShowPopup(Constants.PopupType messageType, string title, string message,
 6             Constants.PopupButtons buttons, int width, int height, bool refreshPage)
 7         {
 8             const string pageUrlFormat = "{0}?Type={1}&Title={2}&Message={3}&Options={4}&isDlg=1";
 9             const string dialogStringFormat = "openInDialog({0}, {1}, false, true, {2},'{3}');";
10 
11             string pageUrl = string.Format(pageUrlFormat, Constants.ShowMessagePage, messageType, title, message,
12                 buttons);
13             string dialogString = string.Format(dialogStringFormat, width, height, refreshPage.ToString().ToLower(),
14                 pageUrl);
15 
16             return dialogString;
17         }
18 
19         public static string ShowPopupAndRedirect(Constants.PopupType messageType, string title, string message,
20             Constants.PopupButtons buttons, int width, int height, string redirectUrl)
21         {
22             const string pageUrlFormat = "{0}?Type={1}&Title={2}&Message={3}&Options={4}&isDlg=1";
23             const string dialogStringFormat = "openInDialogAndRedirect({0}, {1}, false, true, '{2}','{3}');";
24 
25             string pageUrl = string.Format(pageUrlFormat, Constants.ShowMessagePage, messageType, title, message,
26                 buttons);
27             string dialogString = string.Format(dialogStringFormat, width, height, pageUrl, redirectUrl);
28 
29             return dialogString;
30         }
31     }
32 }

JavaScript Functions

 1 function openInDialog(dlgWidth, dlgHeight, dlgAllowMaximize, dlgShowClose, needCallbackFunction, pageUrl ) {
 2     var options = {
 3         url: pageUrl,
 4         width: dlgWidth,
 5         height: dlgHeight,
 6         allowMaximize: dlgAllowMaximize,
 7         showClose: dlgShowClose
 8     };
 9 
10     if (needCallbackFunction) {
11         options.dialogReturnValueCallback = Function.createDelegate(null, CloseDialogCallback);
12     }
13     SP.SOD.execute('sp.ui.dialog.js', 'SP.UI.ModalDialog.showModalDialog', options);
14 }
15 
16 
17 var redirectUrlValue = "";
18 
19 function openInDialogAndRedirect(dlgWidth, dlgHeight, dlgAllowMaximize, dlgShowClose, pageUrl, redirectUrl ) {
20     var options = {
21         url: pageUrl,
22         width: dlgWidth,
23         height: dlgHeight,
24         allowMaximize: dlgAllowMaximize,
25         showClose: dlgShowClose
26     };
27     redirectUrlValue = redirectUrl;
28     options.dialogReturnValueCallback = Function.createDelegate(null, CloseDialogAndRedirectCallback);
29 
30     SP.SOD.execute('sp.ui.dialog.js', 'SP.UI.ModalDialog.showModalDialog', options);
31 }
32 
33 function CloseDialogCallback(dialogResult, returnValue) {
34     if (dialogResult == SP.UI.DialogResult.OK) { // refresh parent page
35         SP.SOD.execute('sp.ui.dialog.js', 'SP.UI.ModalDialog.RefreshPage', SP.UI.DialogResult.OK);
36 
37     }
38     // if user click on Close or Cancel
39     else if (dialogResult == SP.UI.DialogResult.cancel) { // Do Nothing or add any logic you want 
40     } else { //alert("else " + dialogResult);
41     }
42 }
43 
44 function CloseDialogAndRedirectCallback(dialogResult, returnValue) {
45     if (dialogResult == SP.UI.DialogResult.OK) { // refresh parent page
46         SP.SOD.execute('sp.ui.dialog.js', 'SP.UI.ModalDialog.RefreshPage', SP.UI.DialogResult.OK);
47         window.location.href = redirectUrlValue;
48     }
49     // if user click on Close or Cancel
50     else if (dialogResult == SP.UI.DialogResult.cancel) { // Do Nothing or add any logic you want 
51     } else { //alert("else " + dialogResult);
52     }
53 }

Constants Class

 1 namespace SharePointPopups.Common
 2 {
 3     public static class Constants
 4     {
 5         public enum PopupButtons
 6         {
 7             Ok,
 8             OkCancel
 9         }
10 
11         public enum PopupType
12         {
13             Information,
14             Warning,
15             Error
16         }
17 
18         public const string ErrorImage = "/Style%20Library/Custom%20Images/Error.png";
19         public const string WarnImage = "/Style%20Library/Custom%20Images/Warn.png";
20         public const string InfoImage = "/Style%20Library/Custom%20Images/Info.png";
21 
22         public const string MessageTitleQueryName = "Title";
23         public const string MessageContentQueryName = "Message";
24         public const string MessageTypeQueryName = "Type";
25         public const string MessageOptionsQueryName = "Options";
26 
27         public const string ShowMessagePage = "/_layouts/15/SharePointPopups/ShowMessage.aspx";
28     }
29 }

Usage

This is how we call the Dialog box from C#. What we are actually doing here is calling the JavaScript Function using Page.ClientScript.RegisterStartupScript.
PopupOperations.ShowPopup & PopupOperations.ShowPopupAndRedirect creates the required function call with the appropriate urls.
The last parameter in the PopupOperations.ShowPopup defines if the page needs to be refreshed.
Similarly the last parameter in the PopupOperations.ShowPopupAndRedirect defines the page to which the the user needs to be redirected on pressing “OK”

Show Popup

1 Page.ClientScript.RegisterStartupScript(typeof (Page), "Popout Script",
2                 PopupOperations.ShowPopup(Constants.PopupType.Information,
3                     "Information Message",
4                     "This is a popup with OK Button. Clicking OK Will refresh the page.",
5                     Constants.PopupButtons.Ok,
6                     500, 210, true)
7                 , true);

Show Popup & Redirect

1 Page.ClientScript.RegisterStartupScript(typeof (Page), "Popout Script",
2                 PopupOperations.ShowPopupAndRedirect(Constants.PopupType.Error,
3                     "Error Message",
4                     "This is a popup with OK Button. Clicking OK will redirect to the settings page.",
5                     Constants.PopupButtons.Ok,
6                     500, 210,
7                     "/_layouts/15/settings.aspx")
8                 , true);
Downloads

Once the solution is deployed, the webpart can be found in the WebParts Gallery under the HowCanIDoIt category.
